intro: Viola procera, commonly known as the tall violet, is a species of flowering plant in the Violaceae family. It is native to parts of Europe, North Africa, and western Asia. This perennial herb typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring heart-shaped leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
